revision.text:
'''Daniel Baker''' is an [[artist]] and producer of [[alternative comics]]. He was born in [[Bath, Somerset|Bath]], [[England]] in 1979. He lives and works in [[London]].
The first issue of Baker's new comic series [[Donkey Head]] was published in 2005, and launched at the [http://www.clowns-international.co.uk/Our.Gallery.htm Clown Museum] in east London. The series is ongoing.
He has been involved in many exhibitions, including ''[http://www.cca.rca.ac.uk/thismuchiscertain/ This Much is Certain]'' at the [[Royal College of Art]] in [[London]] and a solo show at [[The Modern Institute]] in [[Glasgow]].
Throughout 2007 he was Artist in Residence at the [[Old Operating Theatre Museum]] and [[Herb Garret]] in [[London]] where he developed his [http://www.papertheatres.blogspot.com/ Paper Theatre Projects]. In this new series of sculptures, drawings, and slideshows, Baker re-invents the popular toy theatre of the 18th and 19th Century as a tool to explore discourses of sight, medicine, technology, and the history of ephemeral media.
== External links == * [http://www.danielbaker.org/ Daniel Baker website] * [http://www.papertheatres.blogspot.com/ Paper Theatre Projects] * [http://www.donkeyhead.org/ Donkey Head website] * [http://www.cca.rca.ac.uk/thismuchiscertain/exhib_baker.html Artist's page on ''This Much is Certain'' website] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20061120133218/http://www.bugpowder.com/trs2/06/08/22/donkey_head_1_by_daniel_baker.html Bugpowder review of Donkey Head]
